oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: "War Declared: The Strong-Minded in Convention at Saratoga"
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The article reports on a resolution drafted by New York women at a convention in Saratoga. They demanded the right of suffrage and opposed men seeking to define the sphere of women.
This convention took place 21 years after the women's rights convention at Seneca Falls in 1848, the first such convention in the United States.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: [Nashville] Republican Banner
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Women--Civil Rights
Politicians; Political participation; Women; Suffrage; Susan B. Anthony
